channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2023081791
item.description:
Report X-2023081791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload during sort, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package appears to be leaking due to bottom of container failing. This is possibly due to low quality outer packaging. Package also had no outer packaging, cap seals, or any bracing for the container or its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081634
item.description:
Report X-2023081634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found leaking. Placed in tote to prevent further leakage. DescribePack: Package is a 5 gal plastic pail with the lid coming off. No cap seals or bracing for contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080384
item.description:
Report X-2023080384

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DAY SORT SUPERVISOR SAW A WET HAZMAT BOX ON THE SORT AISLE PLATFORM. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX AND NOTICED THAT ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND THE OTHER BOTTLES INSIDE THE BOX WERE WET.
